description: Provides a summarized description of the specified Kinesis data stream without the shard list. The information returned includes the stream name, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), status, record retention period, approximate creation time, monitoring, encryption details, and open shard count.

nested_items.name: StreamDescriptionSummary
nested_items.description: A  StreamDescriptionSummary containing information about the stream.

nested_items.name: StreamName
nested_items.description: The name of the stream being described.

nested_items.name: StreamARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the stream being described.

nested_items.name: StreamStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the stream being described. The stream status is one of the following states:
CREATING - The stream is being created. Kinesis Data Streams immediately returns and sets StreamStatus to CREATING.
DELETING - The stream is being deleted. The specified stream is in the DELETING state until Kinesis Data Streams completes the deletion.
ACTIVE - The stream exists and is ready for read and write operations or deletion. You should perform read and write operations only on an ACTIVE stream.
UPDATING - Shards in the stream are being merged or split. Read and write operations continue to work while the stream is in the UPDATING state.

nested_items.name: StreamModeDetails
nested_items.description: Specifies the capacity mode to which you want to set your data stream. Currently, in Kinesis Data Streams, you can choose between an on-demand ycapacity mode and a provisioned capacity mode for your data streams.

nested_items.name: StreamMode
nested_items.description: Specifies the capacity mode to which you want to set your data stream. Currently, in Kinesis Data Streams, you can choose between an on-demand capacity mode and a provisioned capacity mode for your data streams.

nested_items.name: RetentionPeriodHours
nested_items.description: The current retention period, in hours.

nested_items.name: StreamCreationTimestamp
nested_items.description: The approximate time that the stream was created.

nested_items.name: EnhancedMonitoring
nested_items.description: Represents the current enhanced monitoring settings of the stream.

nested_items.name: ShardLevelMetrics
nested_items.description: List of shard-level metrics.
IncomingBytes.
IncomingRecords.
OutgoingBytes.
OutgoingRecords.
WriteProvisionedThroughputExceeded.
ReadProvisionedThroughputExceeded.
IteratorAgeMilliseconds.
ALL.

nested_items.name: EncryptionType
nested_items.description: The encryption type used. This value is one of the following:
KMS.
NONE.

nested_items.name: KeyId
nested_items.description: The GUID for the customer-managed Amazon Web Services KMS key to use for encryption. This value can be a globally unique identifier, a fully specified ARN to either an alias or a key, or an alias name prefixed by 'alias/'.You can also use a master key owned by Kinesis Data Streams by specifying the alias aws/kinesis.
Alias ARN example: arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:123456789012:alias/MyAliasName.
Globally unique key ID example: 12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012
Alias name example: alias/MyAliasName.
Master key owned by Kinesis Data Streams: alias/aws/kinesis.

nested_items.name: OpenShardCount
nested_items.description: The number of open shards in the stream.

nested_items.name: ConsumerCount
nested_items.description: The number of enhanced fan-out consumers registered with the stream.
